goals.question: What is the distribution of flight delays?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of flight delays and the range of delay times.

goals.question: What is the relationship between flight distance and arrival delay?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of flight distance vs arrival delay
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between flight distance and arrival delay.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight cancellations by airline?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of airline vs number of cancelled flights
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand which airlines have the highest number of cancelled flights.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight cancellations by month?
goals.visualization: Line chart of month vs number of cancelled flights
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there are any seasonal trends in flight cancellations.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight delays by day of the week?
goals.visualization: Box plot of day of the week vs departure delay
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there are any differences in flight delays based on the day of the week.

code:
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='departure_delay', bins=50)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of flight delays?', wrap=True)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='flight_distance', y='arrival_delay')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between flight distance and arrival delay?', wrap=True)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    ax = sns.barplot(x='airline', y='cancelled_flights', data=data)
    ax.set_xticklabels(ax.get_xticklabels(), rotation=45, ha='right')
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('What is the distribution of flight cancellations by airline?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='ignore')
    data['month'] = data['date'].dt.month
    cancelled_flights = data[data['cancelled'] == 1].groupby('month').size().reset_index(name='num_cancelled')
    
    sns.lineplot(x='month', y='num_cancelled', data=cancelled_flights)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of flight cancellations by month?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.boxplot(x='day_of_week', y='departure_delay', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of flight delays by day of the week?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
